== ReApproval Application 2012 ==

=== Key Details ===

* Date: 2012-07-16
* Approved: 2009-03-31, reapproved 2010-04-20
* Team contacts - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~dmitry-agafonov]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~malamut]]</nowiki>
* Membership: ~1100 (~800 users and ~300 members in local&working groups <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-ru/+members|listed]]</nowiki>)
* Web site - http://ubuntu.ru/
* Documentation wiki - http://help.ubuntu.ru/
* Team wiki - http://team.ubuntu.ru/
* Activity tracking at LP: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-ru
* Support:
** Forum - http://forum.ubuntu.ru/
** Mailing list - ubuntu-ru @ lists.ubuntu.com
** IRC - #ubuntu-ru @ freenode.net
** Jabber - ubuntu @ conference.jabber.ru
* LoCo coordination - loco @ conference.ubuntu.ru

=== Road Map ===

==== Current Developments ====
* Translate Quantal Quetzal to Russian
* Test Quantal Quetzal

==== Mid- and Long-term targets ====
* Create Ubuntu Russian Remix
* More local activities via city subteams

==== Ongoing activities ====
* Provide support by any means feasible on-line (forum, jabber, irc; one of ideas currently in development: pool of people able to provide on-line support directly) as well as off-line (e.g. gather information where interested people can get a disc with distribution) to Russian-speaking users
* Spread word about FOSS in general and Ubuntu in particular
* Involve more people in real-life activities: extend geography of our non-virtual presence 

=== Experience ===

==== LoCo ====

Team work:
* The working groups as <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-ru/+members | subgroups of ~ubuntu-ru]]</nowiki>
* Mailing lists for the working groups
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-ru | Ubuntu-ru meta-project]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu-ru | Bug tracker]]</nowiki> to organize work processes, for status monitoring and troubleshooting
* <nowiki>[[http://forum.ubuntu.ru/index.php?board=44.0 | Dedicated forum section]]</nowiki> to discuss ongoing work
* On-line <nowiki>[[http://team.ubuntu.ru/ | teams' home]]</nowiki>
* Coordination via Jabber channel loco @ conference.ubuntu.ru

==== Translations ====

===== Russian Ubuntu Translators =====
* Home: https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-ru
* 67 members, about 1400 various contributors
* Ubuntu (on-CD packages) translation stats (http://91.189.93.77/stats/):
** 10.04: 100% translated, 9th in list
** 11.04: 99% translated, 5th in list
** 11.10: 100% translated, 8th in list
** 12.04: 100% translated, 3rd in list
* Accepts feedback from users via e-mail: translation-bugs@ubuntu.ru
* Uses bug tracker: https://bugs.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-ru

===== Full Circle Magazine =====
* Issues 0,1,20-43 were translated into Russian and currently project is frozen
* Home page http://fullcirclemagazine.ru/
* Archives: http://ubuntu.ru/fullcircle

==== Resources ====

===== ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.ru/|A good starting point]]</nowiki> to join Ubuntu community and investigate what Ubuntu is
* Just got new design and integrated into other Russian Ubuntu resources
* About 500'000 page views from 250'000 visitors monthly

===== forum.ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://forum.ubuntu.ru/|Our forum]]</nowiki> is the best resource on Ubuntu in Russian providing support for users
* > 100'000 registered users, almost 2'000'000 messages in 130'000 threads
* Extremely popular: about 3'000'000 views from about 1'200'000 visitors monthly

===== help.ubuntu.ru =====

* <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.ru/|Consolidated wiki in Russian]]</nowiki> with user's documentation.
* <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.ru/manual|Russian Ubuntu guide for beginners]]</nowiki>.
* <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.ru/%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%8C|Hardware compatibility information]]</nowiki> collected by our users.
* About 300'000 visitors with > 650'000 page views per month.
